page.title: 02ARNCLIFFE, LITTONDALE
page.content: Arncliffe lies in the valley bottom where Cowside Beck joins the River Skirfare. All the buildings are of local stone, and blend naturally with the surrounding scenery. Twenty-seven of the houses are permanently occupied, eight are unoccupied for long periods, and one is derelict. The village has its own church, school and village hall, and these serve the rest of the dale as well. In the centre of the large village green is an old water pump which, seventy years ago, supplied the cottages in the village, now the village supply comes from the nearby hill. There is an inn, a hotel, a post office and a grocery shop, and three travelling shops come to the village, a green grocer, a grocer, and butcher.
